text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to state that the user's potential personal claim for breach of trust against the ex-partner is enforceable against their other assets, not just the property. The candidate answer explicitly states this under Section 1, in the 'Equitable remedies' row: 'These are personal rights against the party who caused the equity (your ex). They give you a claim for money or a share of the proceeds when the property is sold...'. It reiterates this under Section 2: 'Conversely, if the mortgage survives, you will still have a personal claim against your ex for: 1. Contribution / accounting... 2. Unjust enrichment... 3. Damages for breach of fiduciary duty / misrepresentation... The bank\u2019s priority does not extinguish your right to sue the ex; it only means the bank gets paid first out of the sale proceeds.' This directly addresses the requirement.", "criterion_id": "ae70b466-524f-4800-bd58-e231000255cf"}
